meanings.definition: To move quickly and forcefully in a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: The kids were storming towards the playground after school.
meanings.sent2: The athletes were storming towards the finish line in the race.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was storming up the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: The protesters were storming through the streets demanding change.
meanings.sent5: The waves were storming against the cliffs during the storm.

meanings.definition: To attack or capture (a place) by a sudden assault.
meanings.sent1: The pirates were storming the enemy ship to take control.
meanings.sent2: The burglars were storming the bank to rob it.
meanings.sent3: The kids were storming the fort in their game of pretend.
meanings.sent4: The protesters were storming the government building to make their voices heard.
meanings.sent5: The soldiers were storming the enemy camp under the cover of darkness.

meanings.definition: A violent disturbance of the atmosphere with strong winds and usually rain, thunder, lightning, or snow.
meanings.sent1: The storming outside caused the power outage in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The forecast predicted severe storming in the evening.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected storming caught everyone off guard during the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The loud storming kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent5: The intense storming damaged many trees in the area.
